content: The backlash to MBAs was to re-tilt the balance from “business people” to “builders” some 20 years ago. It’s a pretty core ethos in “Hackers and Painters” of Graham’s, for example. I think it was a positive thing that the Valley needed to do so VCs stopped being ridiculous and replacing Founder/CEOs who didn’t have MBAs or sales experience. But as usual painting with a broad brush is stupid. You make an excellent point.
